CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, June 18, 1949, p. 13, reads: "Centre Avenue Station Reopens - The racially mixed staff which appears in top left photo looked across the desk at the six white men, one colored women, and one white woman who appears for hearings at Centre Avenue Station on Tuesday morning following the reopening ceremonies at the station Monday night. They were the main reason for the rejoicing in the Negro community at the reopening ceremony for a remodeled 'lockup.' Center middle photo: Director Fairley formally presents the keys to Centre Avenue Station to Superintendent of Police Harvey Scott as Assistant Superintendent of Police Andrew Charles looks on... Other photos by Charles Harris."
TitMainTitle: Director of Public Safety Col. George Fairley presenting keys to Police Superintendent Harvey Scott, with Andrew Charles in background, in Centre Avenue police station
